data.short_description: API to execute Notebook and Script Jobs
data.long_description: This API endpoint acts as a delegation endpoint for the common jobs api (v2/jobs) for notebooks and scripts. It receives meta data about a job and the requested action (run, cancel, ..) and will then create the artifacts in the kubernetes layer to perform the job execution (via the runtimes manager). During the execution of the job it will monitor progress and update state within the common jobs api. At the end of a run, it will capture the logs as well.

data.short_description: UI to work with notebooks
data.long_description: This UI services offers UI components to manage notebooks and notebook versions. Operations include the creation of the notebook asset, viewing a read only version of a notebook, launching a Jupyter container to work with the notebook, changing the environment that is associated with a notebook , creating a job for the notebook. It also allows to work with notebook versions. Operations include the creation of a notebook version, its rendering and lifecycle management. Also sharing of notebooks is done via this UI service.

data.long_description: Use the IBM Match 360 with Watson service's data quality and matching capabilities to quickly build master data pipelines for analytics and other data science use cases.Start with your InfoSphere MDM Standard or Advanced Edition entity data or with any data assets in your knowledge catalog that contain person or organization records. Quickly map and model new attributes to your IBM Match 360 with Watson data model for a more complete view of your customers. The AI-powered matching engine speeds your master data configuration using the same statistical methods you can rely on to produce accurate match results. View and work with the resulting master data entities online in the IBM Match 360 entity explorer, in exported flat files, or by using RESTful APIs.

k8s_objects.name: mdm-em-ui
k8s_objects.short_description: The mdm-em-ui service defines the user inferface for the IBM Match 360 master data explorer capabilities that are provided by the mdm-data service
troubleshooting: Check for mdm-em-ui pods status. The mdm-em-ui service has a dependency on Redis. If the service is down, please check the Redis pod status

data.short_description: Provide Key-Value pair database service
data.long_description: FDB is a key-value database to support Janus Graph and other Meta data requirement of its client

k8s_objects.name: foundationdb
k8s_objects.short_description: FDB cluster
k8s_objects.long_description: FDB cluster is the database that provides key-value database service in a cluster mode, it will generate a number of pods which function as different role like storage/log/controller/backup/restore.   The log/storage/backup will have pvc created for them.  restore pod only appears if the cluster enter restore mode.
troubleshooting: Check the process fdbserver is running inside the pods and also run fdbcli --exec 'status details' to see what's the error

data.long_description: Use the IBM Match 360 with Watson service's data quality and matching capabilities to quickly build master data pipelines for analytics and other data science use cases.Start with your InfoSphere MDM Standard or Advanced Edition entity data or with any data assets in your knowledge catalog that contain person or organization records. Quickly map and model new attributes to your IBM Match 360 with Watson data model for a more complete view of your customers. The AI-powered matching engine speeds your master data configuration using the same statistical methods you can rely on to produce accurate match results. View and work with the resulting master data entities online in the IBM Match 360 entity explorer, in exported flat files, or by using RESTful APIs.

k8s_objects.name: foundationdb
k8s_objects.short_description: FDB cluster
k8s_objects.long_description: FDB cluster is the database that provides key-value database service in a cluster mode, it will generate a number of pods which function as different role like storage/log/controller/backup/restore.   The log/storage/backup will have pvc created for them.  restore pod only appears if the cluster enter restore mode.
troubleshooting: Check the process fdbserver is running inside the pods and also run fdbcli --exec 'status details' to see what's the error
Also check in the /var/log/fdb-trace-logs for error in the trace log and/or fdbmonitor.log

data.short_description: Decision Optimization Setup
data.long_description: The Decision Optimization setup components prepare Decision Optimization add-on for use in Cloud Pak for Data.

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-config
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization Configuration Map.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization Configuration Map declares the Decision Optimization add-on in Cloud Pak for Data, and provides its version.
It is installed by the Decision Optimization add-on operator during the add-on installation.
If the map is deleted, the add-on will appear as uninstalled, and Decision Optimization Experiment will be unavailable.

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-init
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization initialization job.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization initialization job installs the Decision Optimization libraries used by Notebooks to perform Decision Optimization solves.
It is run by the Decision Optimization add-on operator during the add-on installation.
If the job fails, the Decision Optimization add-on operator will declare a failed installation.

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-uninstall
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization cleanup job.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization cleanup job removes the Decision Optimization libraries used by Notebooks to perform Decision Optimization solves.
It is run by the Decision Optimization add-on operator during the add-on uninstallation.
If the job fails, those unused libraries will be left behind (which has no user impact).

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-zen-frontdoor-extension
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization front door extension.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization front door extension adds Decision Optimization API and UI entry points to the global Cloud Pak for Data frontdoor.
It is installed by the Decision Optimization add-on operator during the add-on installation.
If the extension is deleted, the Decision Optimization add-on will be unreachable.

k8s_objects.name: ibm-cpd-dods-operator
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization Operator.
k8s_objects.long_description: The Decision Optimization Operator is responsible for the installation/uninstallation and management of Decision Optimization add-on in Cloud Pak for Data.

data.short_description: Decision Optimization UI
data.long_description: The Decision Optimization UI manages the Graphical User Interface for Decision Optimization Experiments.

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-scenario-ui
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization UI.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization UI manages the Graphical User Interface for Decision Optimization Experiments
If the module is down, creation and modification of Decision Optimization Experiments will fail.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly, in particular the Decision Optimization backend
Ensure pods are not in pending state due to unavailable requested cpu and memory

data.short_description: Decision Optimization Backend APIs
data.long_description: The Decision Optimization Backend APIs manage resources and operations for Decision Optimization.

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-scenario-api
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization Experiment and Scenario data API.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization Experiment and Scenario data API manages resources and operations for Decision Optimization. It handles Scenario and Experiment lifecycles as well as coordinating the Decision Optimization solve.
If the deployment is down, it will impact all Decision Optimization UI operations and any existing solves that are running.
Solve operations rely on the Watson Machine Learning module, and might fail if it is down.
Notebook operations rely on the Watson Studio module, and might fail if it is down.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly
Ensure pods are not in pending state due to unavailable requested cpu and memory

k8s_objects.name: dods-ibm-dods-dd-cognitive
k8s_objects.short_description: Decision Optimization Modeling Assistant API.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The Decision Optimization Modeling Assistant API manages resources and operations for the Modeling Assistant in Decision Optimization Experiments. It handles editions, suggestions, and solve preparation for Modeling Assistant models.
If the deployment is down, Decision Optimization UI operations related to Modeling Assistant will fail.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly
Ensure pods are not in pending state due to unavailable requested cpu and memory

data.short_description: Aggregate, govern, and syndicate trusted product information across your organization.
data.long_description: The IBM Product Master service provides trusted product information management (PIM) and collaborative master data management (MDM) capabilities. With Product Master, you can create an accurate and up-to-date repository of product and service information to support strategic business initiatives across your organization. To ensure data accuracy and consistency, Product Master: Aggregates information from upstream systems, Enforces business processes, Synchronizes trusted information with downstream systems

k8s_objects.short_description: StatefulSet for handling Product Master PIM Collector.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly
Verify the network connectivity between the fts-pim pod and DB
For more detailed troubleshooting instructions, refer to the following documentation: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.7.x?topic=troubleshooting-product-master

data.short_description: OpenScale Kafka event streaming service
data.long_description: IBM Watson OpenScale Kafka service helps buffer AI scoring payload records before persisting them into payload-logging database like DB2

k8s_objects.name: aiopenscale-ibm-aios-kafka
k8s_objects.short_description: IBM Watson OpenScale Kafka service
troubleshooting: OpenScale Kafka statefulset is a self contained event streaming service.
Kafka pods are backed up by persistent volumes. If Kafka pods are failing to start, it could be a case of corrupted data.
The Kafka data is temporary and need not be periodically backed up.
Follow CPD documentation to reset Kafka data if any of the Kafka pods are failing to start.

k8s_objects.name: aiopenscale-ibm-aios-kafka-secrets
k8s_objects.short_description: IBM Watson OpenScale Kafka service connection credentials secret

data.short_description: Detect and mitigate AI model drift
data.long_description: IBM Watson OpenScale provides a mechanism for enterprises to monitor if their AI model performance is drifting from the expected behavior over a period of time. Drift can either be a change in the runtime accuracy of the model or a drift in the input data characteristics.

k8s_objects.name: aiopenscale-ibm-aios-drift
k8s_objects.short_description: IBM Watson OpenScale drift detection service
troubleshooting: Drift detection module relies on OpenScale infrastructure services.
Ensure configuration, datamart, payload-logging, ml-gateway, scheduling, etcd and kafka pods are running.

data.short_description: OpenScale Etcd persistent datastore
data.long_description: IBM Watson OpenScale persists all its configuration metadata in Etcd provisioned along with the OpenScale service.

k8s_objects.name: aiopenscale-ibm-aios-etcd
k8s_objects.short_description: IBM Watson OpenScale Etcd service
troubleshooting: OpenScale Etcd statefulset is a self contained persistent store.
To help with disaster recovery, make sure the OpenScale Etcd persistent volumes are periodically backed up using CPD backup tooling.
If any of the Etcd pods are failing to start, it could be a case of corrupted data. Please contact IBM support.

k8s_objects.name: aiopenscale-ibm-aios-etcd-secrets
k8s_objects.short_description: IBM Watson OpenScale Etcd connection credentials secret

data.short_description: Job that runs periodically to determine that PASS pods are running and match the targetstate configmap's configurations.
data.long_description: Job that runs periodically to determine that PASS pods are running and match the targetstate configmap's configurations. Schedules pods to scale up or down based on load metrics or manual config changes. Scaling Algorithm is responsible for 3 pods which run PASS: 1. evalservice 2. tm1webproxy 3. tm1web.

k8s_objects.name: scalingalgorithm
k8s_objects.short_description: Cron Job triggers the scalingalgorithm to run periodically and check PASS pod states to determine if they match the targetstate configmap.
k8s_objects.long_description: Scaling Algorithm is responsible for 3 pods which run PASS: 1. evalservice 2. tm1webproxy 3. tm1web. Description of the 3 different PASS pods: evalservice - Provides REST API endpoints for the websheet service and PAfE Excel to send batched work entry requests to execute against PAE, tm1webproxy - HAProxy that handles session affinity for PASS services and user sessions. Routes user sessions to the appropriate pods running PASS, tm1web - HAProxy that handles session affinity for PASS services and user sessions. Runs the websheet service for Planning Analytics Spreadsheet Services.
troubleshooting: Review logs to determine if a fatal error occurred.
If scalingalgorithm pods are not cleared out, it means there was a failure that should be reviewed.
If websheets aren't loading, ensure that tm1webproxy pods have been allocated enough pod resources to run PASS.
If the websheet service has poor performance, consider scaling up the number of tm1webproxy pods and their resource allocation.
Ensure that active session is still valid by refreshing PAW navigation tree and websheet widget.
If websheets aren't loading, ensure that EvaluationService pods have been allocated enough JVM and pod resources to run PASS.
If the EvaluationService has poor performance, consider scaling up the number of tm1web pods and their resource allocation.

data.short_description: Pod responsible for taking user input in a web interface and making calls to apiserver with the user input.
data.long_description: The pod is responsible for the graphical user interface supplied by the replication product into the larger cloudpak platform. It guides the user through replication creation and configuration, as well as running and subsequent monitoring of the data flow and latency. It interacts with common core services jobs to allocate a job for a replication and to schedule a job run for a replication run. The graphical user interface could also be used to review the replication user events or errors. The graphical user interface also interacts with the common core services assets and organizes them in projects or spaces.

k8s_objects.name: replication-ibm-replication-ui
k8s_objects.short_description: Pod responsible for taking user input in a web interface and making calls to apiserver with the user input.
k8s_objects.long_description: The pod is responsible for the graphical user interface supplied by the replication product into the larger cloudpak platform. It guides the user through replication creation and configuration, as well as running and subsequent monitoring of the data flow and latency. It interacts with common core services jobs to allocate a job for a replication and to schedule a job run for a replication run. The graphical user interface could also be used to review the replication user events or errors. The graphical user interface also interacts with the common core services assets and organizes them in projects or spaces.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly

data.short_description: Pod responsible for external replication REST API.
data.long_description: The pod is responsible for taking and validating user input, while interacting with the common core services to create and configure data replication. The pod exposes a REST API to clients communicating with the replication product. It delegates some of the work to the replication-engine pods which are responsible for the actual runtime where replication processes are being executed. The apiserver pods communicate with the cloudpak platform pods for authentication and authorization as well as common core services for asset management.

k8s_objects.name: replication-ibm-replication-apiserver
k8s_objects.short_description: Pod responsible for external replication REST API.
k8s_objects.long_description: The pod is responsible for taking and validating user input, while interacting with the common core services to create and configure data replication. The pod exposes a REST API to clients communicating with the replication product. It delegates some of the work to the replication-engine pods which are responsible for the actual runtime where replication processes are being executed. The apiserver pods communicate with the cloudpak platform pods for authentication and authorization as well as common core services for asset management.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly

data.short_description: Pod responsible for serving as runtime for replication execution.
data.long_description: After starting the replication the apiserver pod or pods determine the engine pods with fewest number of replications allocated to them and schedules the replication to be executed on replication engine pods. After the replication has been allocated to a pod, pause and resume will continue allocating that replication to the same pod. A replication engine pod could change any time a replication has been cancelled and started again.

k8s_objects.name: INSTANCE_NAME-ibm-replication-engine
k8s_objects.short_description: Pod responsible for serving as runtime for replication execution.
k8s_objects.long_description: After starting the replication the apiserver pod or pods determine the engine pods with fewest number of replications allocated to them and schedules the replication to be executed on replication engine pods. After the replication has been allocated to a pod, pause and resume will continue allocating that replication to the same pod. A replication engine pod could change any time a replication has been cancelled and started again. The name of the statefulset is composed of the replication service instance custom resource name (CR) followed by the app name, which at present is ibm-replication-engine. The CR name for a replication service instance is the name supplied by the end user when a new instance is allocated. A default replication-default replication service instance is supplied automatically with the installation of the replication service.
troubleshooting: Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings
Ensure that the pod's dependencies are running correctly

data.short_description: Services that facilitate access and authentication to the control plane.
data.long_description: The zen-gateway services act as a front door for the control plane. The zen-gateway services use nginx technology to authenticate users and to reverse proxy incoming requests to the Kubernetes services created by Cloud Pak for Data components.

k8s_objects.name: ibm-nginx
k8s_objects.short_description: A deployment that manages the pods that act as a front door for the control plane.

k8s_objects.name: ibm-nginx
k8s_objects.short_description: A pod that acts as a front door to the control plane.
k8s_objects.long_description:
The ibm-nginx pods use nginx to:
  • Authenticate user access requests from the web client and from other client applications, such as shell scripts that make curl calls into the cluster.
  • Reverse proxy incoming requests to the Kubernetes services that expose Kubernetes deployments in the cluster. For example, the zen-core-api-svc service exposes the zen-core-api deployment. The service is accessible through the /zen-data/ route. The ibm-nginx pods route any incoming URLs that are prefixed with /zen-data/ to the zen-core-api-svc service. Then, the service uses OpenShift networking to route the requests to one of the zen-core-api pods that are managed by the zen-core-api deployment.

k8s_objects.name: ibm-nginx-tester
k8s_objects.short_description: A deployment that manages the pods that test nginx configurations before they are loaded to the ibm-nginx pod.
k8s_objects.long_description: Services can add locations to nginx by using a front-door extension (zen_front-door). The ibm-zen-operator sends each zen_front-door extension to the ibm-nginx-tester pod. If the ibm-ngnix-tester pod can introduce the location that is specified by the extension without failing, the location is promoted. When the location is promoted, it can be used by the ibm-ngnix pods. The ibm-nginx-tester deployment manages the ibm-nginx-tester pods.

k8s_objects.name: ibm-nginx-tester
k8s_objects.short_description: A pod that tests nginx configurations before they are loaded to the ibm-nginx pod.
k8s_objects.long_description: Services can add locations to nginx by using a front-door extension (zen_front_door). The ibm-zen-operator sends each zen_front_door extension to the ibm-nginx-tester pod. If the ibm-ngnix-tester pod can introduce the location that is specified by the extension without failing, the location is promoted. When the location is promoted, it can be used by the ibm-ngnix pods.

k8s_objects.name: iam-config-job
k8s_objects.short_description: A job that initializes the Identity Management configuration when the platform is integrated with the Identity Management service.
k8s_objects.long_description:
When the platform is integrated with the Identity Management service, the job:
  • Obtains the administrator username (cpdadmin) from the ibm-iam-bindinfo-platform-auth-secret secret.
  • Creates the administrator user in the metastore database for control plane (zen).
  • Creates a Client custom resource object, which establishes the callback relationship and clientId that the control plane can use to make API calls to the Identity Management service.

data.short_description: Backend texted(nosql) based database used by Global Search service (wkc-search). It is provisioned by opencontent elasticsearch operator.
data.long_description:
The database stores information on everything users can search, data assets, terms, data rules, etc. All three ES pods form an elastic/opensearch cluster, if one ES/OS pod is down, for the worst, it could impact the whole ES cluster, then Global Search service will not function well. Furthermore, all services, such glossary terms, data rules, relationship, MDE, etc, cannot save/get their data correctly.

Users may see an error message on the UI "There might be a temporary server outage. Please try again later".

.

k8s_objects.name: elasticsea-0ac3-ib-6fb9-es-server-esnodes
k8s_objects.short_description: Backend texted(nosql) based database used by Global Search service (wkc-search). It is provisioned by opencontent elasticsearch operator.
k8s_objects.long_description: A NodeJS microservice for hosting knowledge catalog centric items such as authentication, session management, and roles. Hosts UI for Catalog management which lists the WKC plan, all catalogs and their creators, and all members of the current account. It also includes setup for BI Reporting.
troubleshooting: Check status/wkc indices of Elasticsearch using below command:
oc exec -it elasticsea-0ac3-ib-6fb9-es-server-esnodes-0 -- curl -XGET -k -uelastic:<es_password> https://localhost:9200/
oc exec -it elasticsea-0ac3-ib-6fb9-es-server-esnodes-0 -- curl -XGET -k -uelastic:<es_password> https://localhost:9200/_cluster/health
oc exec -it elasticsea-0ac3-ib-6fb9-es-server-esnodes-0 -- curl -XGET -k -uelastic:<es_password> https://localhost:9200/_cat/indices
Check the pod logs in container 'haproxy' and 'elasticsearch' for any error messages or warnings.
Remove all ES pods, open content operator will recreate them to form a new ES cluster. user data will NOT be affected, because the pod attached PVC is not removed.

data.short_description: Manages short-lived kubernetes artifacts to support user-initiated runtimes.
data.long_description: The Runtime Assemblies Operator (RTO) pod is responsible for creating and managing kubernetes artifacts which support user-initiated runtimes like Notebooks, RStudio, SPSS Modeler, Data Refinery, and WML. The primary k8s artifact type which drives the RTO pod is an RTA (runtime assembly). RTAs are created, updated, and deleted by another pod called the Runtime Manager (RTM) pod, which exposes a REST service used by other CP4D services to manage user runtimes.

k8s_objects.name: runtime-assemblies-operator
k8s_objects.short_description: Manages short-lived kubernetes artifacts to support user-initiated runtimes.
k8s_objects.long_description: The Runtime Assemblies Operator (RTO) pod is responsible for creating and managing kubernetes artifacts which support user-initiated runtimes like Notebooks, RStudio, SPSS Modeler, Data Refinery, and WML. The primary k8s artifact type which drives the RTO pod is an RTA (runtime assembly). RTAs are created, updated, and deleted by another pod called the Runtime Manager (RTM) pod, which exposes a REST service used by other CP4D services to manage user runtimes.
troubleshooting: Fetch runtime-assemblies-operator pod logs and look for errors. If the logs show etcd or other timeout errors, probably k8s cluster is having stability issues. Verify the health of the cluster separately. If kubernetes is experiencing any sort of performance or stability problems, esp. around etcd, the RTO pod will fail to run correctly.
Since the RTO pod works closely with the RTM pod, fetch runtime-manager-api pod logs and look for errors there, as well.

Fetch all RTA info in the system with 'oc get rta -o yaml' and look for errors or non-normal events recorded in the RTA status. If uploading diagnostics, be sure to include this RTA info, as well, to help with debugging.

Ensure that CCS is running with a t-shirt size that agrees with the current and expected workload of user runtimes. If there are more user runtimes than expected at one time, the RTO pod performance can be affected, leading to delays and errors when creating k8s artifacts for user runtimes.

The primary k8s artifact type which drives the RTO pod is an RTA (runtime assembly). RTAs are created, updated, and deleted by another pod called the Runtime Manager (RTM) pod, which exposes a REST service used by other CP4D services to manage user runtimes.

Verify the health of the cluster separately. If kubernetes is experiencing any sort of performance or stability problems, esp. around etcd, the RTO pod will fail to run correctly.
Since the RTO pod works closely with the RTM pod, fetch runtime-manager-api pod logs and look for errors there, as well.

data.short_description: API for Global Search.
data.long_description: Provides the ability to search for assets, artifacts, data products, relationships.

k8s_objects.name: wkc-search
k8s_objects.short_description: API for Global Search.
k8s_objects.long_description: Provides the ability to create connections and custom datasource types, retrieve lists of those connections and datasource types along with predefined datasource types, retrieve metadata about data assets including basic preview information.
troubleshooting: If the pod is down, it will impact the Global Search functionality and UI pages that rely on Global Search to retrieve data such as the Categories page.
Users may see an error message - The search query didn’t run. Try rephrasing your search or try the search again later.
Check the pod logs for any error messages or warnings. Check status of dependencies using the /v3/search/heartbeat?dependencyChk=true API.
If any of the dependencies are not in ok status, check their pods and pod logs.

data.short_description: Internal REST API service for managing user-initiated runtimes.
data.long_description: The Runtime Manager (RTM) pod handles REST calls made by other CP4D services to start, update, and delete user-initiated runtimes like Notebooks, RStudio, SPSS Modeler, Data Refinery and WML. The RTM REST API is served through CP4D nginx and most endpoints take the form of v2/runtime[s]_<...>. Every REST call to RTM translates into an action on an RTA (runtime assembly), which is a custom k8s artifact (CRD) owned by CP4D CCS.

k8s_objects.name: runtime-manager-api
k8s_objects.short_description: Internal REST API service for managing user-initiated runtimes.
k8s_objects.long_description: The Runtime Manager (RTM) pod handles REST calls made by other CP4D services to start, update, and delete user-initiated runtimes like Notebooks, RStudio, SPSS Modeler, Data Refinery and WML. The RTM REST API is served through CP4D nginx and most endpoints take the form of v2/runtime[s]_<...>. Every REST call to RTM translates into an action on an RTA (runtime assembly), which is a custom k8s artifact (CRD) owned by CP4D CCS.
troubleshooting: If the RTM pod goes down, users may see delays or errors when trying to start or stop their runtimes. For example, they might not be able open Jupyter notebooks (the UI fails to load).

Fetch runtime-manager-api pod logs and look for errors. If the logs show etcd or other timeout errors, probably the k8s cluster is having stability issues. Verify the health of the cluster separately. If kubernetes is experiencing any sort of performance or stability problems, esp. around etcd, the RTM pod will fail to run correctly.
Since the RTM pod works closely with the RTO pod, fetch runtime-assemblies-operator pod logs and look for errors there, as well.

Fetch RTA info with command - oc get rta -o yaml. Look for errors or abnormal events recorded in the RTA status. If uploading diagnostics, be sure to include this RTA info, as well, to help with debugging.

data.short_description: Analytics Engine Powered By Apache Spark
data.long_description: Analytics Engine powered by Apache Spark is used as a compute engine to run analytical and machine learning jobs.

k8s_objects.name: spark-hb-job-cleanup-cron
k8s_objects.short_description: Spark application runtime cleanup
k8s_objects.long_description: The spark-hb-job-cleanup-cron cronjob is responsible for cleaning up orphan spark applications,completed/failed applications to cleanup the used resources
troubleshooting: For troubleshooting, examine pod logs for error messages and warnings. Detailed guidance can be found in the Analyticsengine troubleshooting documentation https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.7.x?topic=troubleshooting-analytics-engine-powered-by-apache-spark

k8s_objects.name: spark-hb-kernel-cleanup-cron
k8s_objects.short_description: Spark kernels runtime cleanup
k8s_objects.long_description: The spark-hb-kernel-cleanup-cron cronjob is responsible for cleaning up active kernel runtimes that are idle for more than 3 hours. The idle time is by default 3 hours but can be configured.
troubleshooting: For troubleshooting, examine pod logs for error messages and warnings. Detailed guidance can be found in the Analyticsengine troubleshooting documentation https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-data/4.7.x?topic=troubleshooting-analytics-engine-powered-by-apache-spark
